intro: Cestichis vestita, commonly known as the naked cestichis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its intricate and often fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as under the canopy of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually slender and covered in a fine, almost imperceptible layer of hair, which contributes to its common name. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Cestichis vestita is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
